TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IStateManager

Docs.summary: Defines the properties and methods any class must implement to support view state management for a server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A server control's view state comprises the cumulative values of the control's properties. This interface includes methods that save and load a server control's view state values, as well as a method that instructs the control to track any changes to its view state.
To customize the way your ASP.NET application manages server control view state, you must create a class that implements this interface because you cannot inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
## Examples The following code example shows a class that implements the IStateManager interface. It includes implementations of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A> methods.
[!code-vb[StateBag_IStateManager_Sample1#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.istatema_1.vb)] [!code-cs[StateBag_IStateManager_Sample1#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.istatema_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: When implemented by a class, gets a value indicating whether a server control is tracking its view state changes.
Docs.value: if a server control is tracking its view state changes; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadViewState(object state) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Object> that contains the saved view state values for the control.
Docs.summary: When implemented by a class, loads the server control's previously saved view state to the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples [!code-vb[StateBag_IStateManager_Sample1#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.istatema_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[StateBag_IStateManager_Sample1#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.istatema_2_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: When implemented by a class, saves the changes to a server control's view state to an <xref:System.Object>.
Docs.returns: The <xref:System.Object> that contains the view state changes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: When implemented by a class, instructs the server control to track changes to its view state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After this method has been called on a server control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property will return `true`.
